name: Picoclash
body:
Picoclash is a strategy game that attempts to bring the battle mechanics from 2D strategy roleplaying games (SRPGs) to your personal computer.

### Running Picoclash
These instructions assume you are running Linux. First you will need to download SDL and its extensions, SDL_image, SDL_ttf, and SDL_mixer. Once you have those installed through your favorite package manager, download the Picoclash source using either of the links above and extract. Then in your terminal:
```
$ cd picoclash
$ make
$ ./Picoclash
```

### Creating your own maps
Anyone can create their own map for Picoclash just by making a text file. All maps are 30x30 and are read from the `maps/` directory. Here is an example of a map file:
```
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
.........H.A.W.H.A.W..........
..........W.A.H.W.A.H.........
..............................
..............................
.......ooooooooooooooo........
..............................
..............................
..............................
..........w.a.h.w.a.h.........
...........h.a.w.h.a.w........
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
..............................
```

Each character represents a square in the map. The key is found below:
```
w: blue warrior
a: blue archer
h: blue healer
W: red warrior
A: red archer
H: red healer
o: rock
.: grass
```

### Contacting me
I'd love to hear your feedback on Picoclash! If you have any ideas to improve the game or would just like to tell me how much you like it (or hate it), drop me a line at fish.ash@gmail.com.
